name: Unit 1: Sets, Relations and Functions
topics: Union, intersection and complement of sets and their algebraic properties
Relations, type of relations, equivalence relations
Functions; one-one, into and onto functions, the composition of functions

name: Unit 2: Complex Numbers and Quadratic Equations
topics: Complex numbers as ordered pairs of reals
Representation of complex numbers in the form a + ib and their representation in a plane
Modulus and argument (or amplitude) of a complex number
Quadratic equations in real and complex number systems and their solutions
The formation of quadratic equations with given roots

name: Unit 3: Matrices and Determinants
topics: Matrices, algebra of matrices, type of matrices
Determinants and matrices of order two and three
Adjoint and inverse of a square matrix
Test of consistency and solution of simultaneous linear equations in two or three variables using matrices

name: Unit 4: Permutations and Combinations
topics: Meaning of P(n, r) and C(n, r)

name: Unit 5: Binomial Theorem and Its Simple Applications
topics: Binomial theorem for a positive integral index

name: Unit 6: Sequence and Series
topics: Insertion of arithmetic, geometric means between two given numbers

name: Unit 7: Limit, Continuity and Differentiability
topics: Real–valued functions, algebra of functions; polynomial, rational, trigonometric, logarithmic and exponential functions; inverse functions
Differentiation of the sum, difference, product and quotient of two functions
Differentiation of trigonometric, inverse trigonometric, logarithmic, exponential, composite and implicit functions
Applications of derivatives: Rate of change of quantities, monotonic-Increasing and decreasing functions, Maxima and minima of functions of one variable

name: Unit 8: Integral Calculus
topics: Fundamental integrals involving algebraic, trigonometric, exponential and logarithmic functions
Integration by substitution, by parts and by partial fractions
Evaluation of simple integrals of the type ...

name: Unit 9: Differential Equations
topics: Ordinary differential equations, their order and degree
Solution of differential equations by the method of separation of variables
Solution of a homogeneous differential equation
Solution of a linear differential equation of the type dy/dx + Py = Q(x)

name: Unit 10: Coordinate Geometry
topics: Cartesian system of rectangular coordinates in a plane
Distance formula, section formula, locus and its equation
Slope of a line, parallel and perpendicular lines, intercepts of a line on the coordinate axis
Straight line: Various forms of equations of a line, intersection of lines, angles between two lines, conditions for concurrence of three lines
Distance of a point from a line
Coordinates of centroid, orthocentre and circumcentre of a triangle
Circle: Standard form of equation, general form of a circle, radius and centre, equation from diameter endpoints
Points of intersection of a line and a circle with centre at origin
Conic sections: Equations of parabola, ellipse and hyperbola in standard forms

name: Unit 11: Three Dimensional Geometry
topics: Coordinates of a point in space
Distance between two points, section formula
Skew lines and shortest distance between them with equation

name: Unit 12: Vector Algebra
topics: Components of a vector in two and three dimensions

name: Unit 13: Statistics and Probability
topics: Measures of dispersion: mean, median, mode of grouped and ungrouped data
Standard deviation, variance and mean deviation (grouped and ungrouped)
Addition and multiplication theorems of probability
Probability distribution of a random variable

name: Unit 14: Trigonometry
topics: Inverse trigonometric functions and their properties

name: Unit 1: Units and Measurements
topics: Units of measurements, system of units, SI Units, fundamental and derived units
Least count, significant figures, errors in measurements

name: Unit 2: Kinematics
topics: Frame of reference, motion in a straight line, speed and velocity
Uniform and non-uniform motion, average speed and instantaneous velocity
Uniformly accelerated motion, velocity-time and position-time graphs
Motion in a plane, projectile motion

name: Unit 3: Laws of Motion
topics: Force and inertia, Newton’s first law of motion
Momentum, Newton’s second law of motion, impulse
Law of conservation of linear momentum and its applications
Static and kinetic friction, laws of friction, rolling friction
Dynamics of uniform circular motion, centripetal force and its applications
Vehicle on a level circular road, vehicle on a banked road

name: Unit 4: Work, Energy and Power
topics: Work done by a constant force and a variable force
Kinetic and potential energies, work-energy theorem, power
Elastic and inelastic collisions in one and two dimensions

name: Unit 5: Rotational Motion
topics: Centre of mass of a two-particle system, centre of mass of a rigid body
Moment of a force, torque, angular momentum
Conservation of angular momentum and its applications
Moment of inertia, radius of gyration
Values of moments of inertia for simple geometrical objects
Parallel and perpendicular axes theorems and their applications
Equilibrium of rigid bodies, rigid body rotation and equations of rotational motion
Comparison of linear and rotational motions

name: Unit 6: Gravitation
topics: Acceleration due to gravity and its variation with altitude and depth
Gravitational potential energy and gravitational potential
Orbital velocity, time period and energy of a satellite

name: Unit 7: Properties of Solids and Liquids
topics: Hooke's Law, Young's modulus, bulk modulus, modulus of rigidity
Pressure due to a fluid column, Pascal's law and its applications
Effect of gravity on fluid pressure
Streamline and turbulent flow, critical velocity
Surface energy and surface tension, angle of contact
Excess of pressure across a curved surface
Applications of surface tension: drops, bubbles and capillary rise
Heat, temperature, thermal expansion, specific heat capacity, calorimetry
Heat transfer: conduction, convection and radiation

name: Unit 8: Thermodynamics
topics: Thermal equilibrium and the concept of temperature
First law of thermodynamics, isothermal and adiabatic processes
Second law of thermodynamics: reversible and irreversible processes

name: Unit 9: Kinetic Theory of Gases
topics: Equation of state of a perfect gas
Work done on compressing a gas
Kinetic theory of gases: assumptions, concept of pressure
Law of equipartition of energy and applications to specific heat capacities of gases

name: Unit 10: Oscillations and Waves
topics: Oscillations and periodic motion: time period, frequency, displacement as a function of time
Simple harmonic motion (S.H.M.) and its equation, phase
Oscillations of a spring: restoring force and force constant
Energy in S.H.M.: kinetic and potential energies
Simple pendulum: derivation of expression for time period
Wave motion: longitudinal and transverse waves
Displacement relation for a progressive wave
Standing waves in strings and organ pipes

name: Unit 11: Electrostatics
topics: Coulomb's law: forces between two point charges, forces between multiple charges
Superposition principle and continuous charge distribution
Electric field: electric field due to a point charge, electric field lines
Electric dipole, electric field due to a dipole, torque on a dipole in a uniform field
Electric flux, Gauss's law and its applications
Field due to infinitely long uniformly charged straight wire
Field due to uniformly charged infinite plane sheet
Field due to uniformly charged thin spherical shell
Electric potential and its calculation for a point charge, electric dipole, and system of charges
Electrical potential energy of a system of two point charges and of an electric dipole in an electrostatic field
Combination of capacitors in series and parallel
Capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor with and without dielectric

name: Unit 12: Current Electricity
topics: Electric current: drift velocity, mobility and their relation with electric current
I-V characteristics of Ohmic and non-ohmic conductors
Series and parallel combinations of resistors
Internal resistance, potential difference and emf of a cell
Combination of cells in series and parallel

name: Unit 13: Magnetic Effects of Current and Magnetism
topics: Biot-Savart law and its application to the current carrying circular loop
Ampere's law and its applications to infinitely long current carrying straight wire and solenoid
Force on a moving charge in uniform magnetic and electric fields
Force on a current-carrying conductor in a uniform magnetic field
Force between two parallel currents carrying conductors, definition of ampere
Torque experienced by a current loop in a uniform magnetic field
Moving coil galvanometer, its sensitivity and conversion to ammeter and voltmeter
Current loop as a magnetic dipole and its magnetic dipole moment
Bar magnet as an equivalent solenoid
Magnetic field due to a magnetic dipole along its axis and perpendicular to its axis
Torque on a magnetic dipole in a uniform magnetic field
Para-, dia-, and ferromagnetic substances with examples
Effect of temperature on magnetic properties

name: Unit 14: Electromagnetic Induction and Alternating Currents
topics: Electromagnetic induction: Faraday's law, induced emf and current
Alternating currents: peak and RMS value of alternating current/voltage
Power in AC circuits, wattless current

name: Unit 15: Electromagnetic Waves
topics: Electromagnetic spectrum: radiowaves, microwaves, infrared, visible, ultraviolet, X-rays, Gamma rays

name: Unit 16: Optics
topics: Reflection of light, spherical mirrors, mirror formula
Refraction of light at plane and spherical surfaces
Thin lens formula and lens maker formula
Total internal reflection and its applications
Combination of thin lenses in contact
Refraction of light through a prism
Microscope and astronomical telescope (reflecting and refracting) and their magnifying powers
Wave optics: wavefront and Huygens’ Principle
Laws of reflection and refraction using Huygens principle
Interference: Young's double-slit experiment and expression for fringe width
Coherent sources and sustained interference of light
Diffraction due to a single slit, width of central maximum
Uses of plane-polarized light and Polaroid

name: Unit 17: Dual Nature of Matter and Radiation
topics: Photoelectric effect, Hertz and Lenard's observations
Matter waves: wave nature of particle

name: Unit 18: Atoms and Nuclei
topics: Bohr model, energy levels, hydrogen spectrum
Binding energy per nucleon and its variation with mass number

name: Unit 19: Electronic Devices
topics: Semiconductor diode: I-V characteristics in forward and reverse bias
I-V characteristics of LED, photodiode, solar cell
Zener diode as a voltage regulator
Logic gates: OR, AND, NOT, NAND, NOR

name: Unit 20: Experimental Skills
topics: Vernier calipers - measure internal/external diameter and depth of vessel
Screw gauge - determine thickness/diameter of thin sheet/wire
Simple pendulum - dissipation of energy (graph between square of amplitude and time)
Metre scale - mass of a given object by principle of moments
Young's modulus of elasticity of metallic wire
Surface tension of water by capillary rise and effect of detergents
Coefficient of viscosity of a liquid by terminal velocity of a sphere
Speed of sound in air at room temperature using resonance tube
Specific heat capacity of solid and liquid (method of mixtures)
Resistivity of a wire using metre bridge
Resistance of a wire using Ohm's law
Resistance and figure of merit of galvanometer (half deflection method)
Focal length of convex mirror (parallax method)
Focal length of concave mirror (parallax method)
Focal length of convex lens (parallax method)
Angle of deviation vs angle of incidence for triangular prism
Refractive index of glass slab using travelling microscope
Characteristic curves of p-n junction diode (forward/reverse bias)
Characteristic curves of Zener diode & reverse breakdown voltage
Identification of diode, LED, resistor, capacitor from mixed collection

name: Unit 1: Some Basic Concepts in Chemistry
topics: Concept of atom, molecule, element and compound

name: Unit 2: Atomic Structure
topics: Dual nature of matter - de Broglie's relationship
Atomic orbitals and radial probability distributions
Shapes of s, p, d orbitals
Electron spin and spin quantum number
Aufbau principle, Pauli’s exclusion principle, Hund’s rule

name: Unit 3: Chemical Bonding and Molecular Structure
topics: Valence Shell Electron Pair Repulsion (VSEPR) theory
Bond order, bond length and bond energy

name: Unit 4: Chemical Thermodynamics
topics: Work, heat, internal energy and enthalpy
Heat capacity and molar heat capacity
Hess’s law of constant heat summation
Enthalpies of bond dissociation, combustion, formation
Phase transition, hydration, ionization and solution enthalpies
Standard Gibbs free energy change and equilibrium constant

name: Unit 5: Solutions
topics: Concentration terms: molality, molarity, mole fraction, percentage
Raoult’s Law - ideal and non-ideal solutions
Molecular mass determination using colligative properties
Abnormal molar mass and van’t Hoff factor

name: Unit 6: Equilibrium
topics: Meaning and concept of dynamic equilibrium
Equilibria involving physical processes: solid-liquid, liquid-gas, gas-gas, solid-gas
Chemical equilibrium: Law of chemical equilibrium, equilibrium constants (Kp, Kc)
Significance of ΔG and ΔG° in equilibrium
Factors affecting equilibrium: concentration, pressure, temperature, catalyst
Ionic equilibrium: weak and strong electrolytes, ionization
Concepts of acids and bases: Arrhenius, Bronsted-Lowry, Lewis
Ionization constants, ionization of water, pH scale
Hydrolysis of salts and pH of solutions
Solubility of sparingly soluble salts and solubility product

name: Unit 7: Redox Reactions and Electrochemistry
topics: Electronic concepts of oxidation and reduction
Molar conductivities and variation with concentration
Electrode potentials and standard electrode potential
EMF of a galvanic cell and its measurement
Relationship between cell potential and Gibbs' free energy change

name: Unit 8: Chemical Kinetics
topics: Factors affecting rate: concentration, temperature, pressure, catalyst
Rate law and rate constant with units
Differential and integral forms of zero-order reactions
Differential and integral forms of first-order reactions
Effect of temperature on reaction rate
Collision theory of bimolecular gaseous reactions

name: Unit 9: Classification of Elements and Periodicity in Properties
topics: Modern periodic law and periodic table
s, p, d, f block elements
Periodic trends: atomic and ionic radii

name: Unit 10: p-Block Elements
topics: Unique behaviour of first element in each group

name: Unit 11: d- and f-Block Elements
topics: General properties of first-row transition elements
Preparation, properties and uses of K2Cr2O7
Preparation, properties and uses of KMnO4
Lanthanoids - electronic configuration and oxidation states
Actinoids - electronic configuration and oxidation states

name: Unit 12: Coordination Compounds
topics: IUPAC nomenclature of mononuclear coordination compounds
Basic ideas of crystal field theory

name: Unit 13: Purification and Characterisation of Organic Compounds
topics: Purification methods: Crystallization, sublimation, distillation, differential extraction, chromatography
Principles and applications of purification techniques
Qualitative analysis: Detection of nitrogen, sulphur, phosphorus, halogens
Quantitative analysis: Estimation of carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, halogens, sulphur, phosphorus
Numerical problems in organic quantitative analysis

name: Unit 14: Some Basic Principles of Organic Chemistry
topics: Shapes of simple molecules and hybridization (s and p)
Classification of organic compounds based on functional groups
Compounds containing halogens, oxygen, nitrogen and sulphur
Covalent bond fission: homolytic and heterolytic
Reaction intermediates: free radicals, carbocations, carbanions
Stability of carbocations and free radicals
Electronic effects: inductive, electromeric, resonance, hyperconjugation
Types of organic reactions: substitution, addition, elimination, rearrangement

name: Unit 15: Hydrocarbons
topics: Alkanes: conformations (Sawhorse and Newman projections of ethane), halogenation mechanism
Alkenes: geometrical isomerism, electrophilic addition mechanism
Addition reactions of alkenes: hydrogen, halogens, water, hydrogen halides (Markownikoff’s rule and peroxide effect)
Alkynes: acidic character, addition of hydrogen, halogens, water, hydrogen halides, polymerization
Aromatic hydrocarbons: benzene structure and aromaticity
Mechanism of electrophilic substitution in benzene
Reactions: halogenation, nitration, Friedel-Craft’s alkylation and acylation
Directive influence of functional groups in mono-substituted benzene

name: Unit 16: Organic Compounds Containing Halogens
topics: Uses of chloroform, iodoform, freons and DDT
Environmental effects of chloroform, freons and DDT

name: Unit 17: Organic Compounds Containing Oxygen
topics: General methods of preparation, properties, reactions and uses
Alcohols: Identification of primary, secondary, tertiary alcohols; mechanism of dehydration
Phenols: Acidic nature, electrophilic substitution reactions (halogenation, nitration, sulphonation), Reimer–Tiemann reaction
Aldehydes and Ketones: Nature of carbonyl group, nucleophilic addition to >C=O group
Relative reactivities of aldehydes and ketones
Important reactions: addition of HCN, NH3 and derivatives, Grignard reagent reactions
Aldol condensation, Cannizzaro reaction, Haloform reaction
Chemical tests to distinguish aldehydes and ketones
Carboxylic acids: Acidic strength and factors affecting it

name: Unit 18: Organic Compounds Containing Nitrogen
topics: General methods of preparation, properties, reactions and uses
Amines: Nomenclature, classification, structure, basic character
Identification of primary, secondary, tertiary amines
Diazonium salts: preparation, reactions and importance in organic synthesis

name: Unit 19: Biomolecules
topics: General introduction and importance of biomolecules
Proteins: α-amino acids, peptide bond, polypeptides
Levels of protein structure: primary, secondary, tertiary, quaternary
Nucleic acids: chemical constitution of DNA and RNA, biological functions

name: Unit 20: Principles Related to Practical Chemistry
topics: Detection of extra elements in organic compounds: nitrogen, sulphur, halogens
Detection of functional groups: hydroxyl, carbonyl, carboxyl, amino
Chemistry of preparation of inorganic compounds: Mohr’s salt, potash alum
Preparation of organic compounds: acetanilide, p-nitro acetanilide, aniline yellow, iodoform
Oxalic acid vs KMnO4, Mohr’s salt vs KMnO4 titrations
Qualitative salt analysis: Cations (Pb2+, Cu2+, Al3+, Fe3+, Zn2+, Ni2+, Ca2+, Ba2+, Mg2+, NH4+)
Qualitative salt analysis: Anions (CO3²⁻, S²⁻, SO4²⁻, NO3⁻, NO2⁻, Cl⁻, Br⁻, I⁻)
Enthalpy experiments: enthalpy of solution of CuSO4, enthalpy of neutralization
Preparation of colloids: lyophilic and lyophobic sols
Kinetics: study of iodide + hydrogen peroxide reaction at room temperature

name: Chapter 1: Number System
topics: Natural, Whole, Integers, Rational, Irrational, Real numbers

name: Chapter 4: Mensuration & Geometry
topics: Plane Geometry (lines, angles, triangles, quadrilaterals, circles)
Mensuration (2D & 3D): area, perimeter, volume, surface area

name: Chapter 5: Time, Work & Distance
topics: Time, Speed & Distance (average speed, relative speed)

name: Chapter 6: Data Handling & Statistics

topics: Environmental Impacts: Melting glaciers, biodiversity loss, desertification

Social Impacts: Migration, food & water security, health risks

name: Chapter 4: Climate Change & India
topics: Vulnerability of India (Himalayan region, coastal areas, monsoon shifts)

topics: National Action Plan on Climate Change (NAPCC) – 8 Missions

topics: Climate Finance (Green Climate Fund, Adaptation Fund)

topics: Climate Equity & Common But Differentiated Responsibilities (CBDR)

Mains Answer Writing Practice (GS III, Essay Topics)

name: Chapter 1: Introduction to Social Sector Initiatives
topics: Importance for inclusive growth & human development
Role of government, civil society, and international organizations

name: Chapter 2: Education Sector Initiatives
topics: Skill development initiatives: PMKVY, Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana

name: Chapter 3: Health & Nutrition Initiatives
topics: National Health Mission (NHM), Ayushman Bharat – PMJAY

name: Chapter 4: Women & Child Development Initiatives
topics: Maternity benefits: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)

name: Chapter 5: Social Justice & Welfare Initiatives
topics: Scheduled Castes & Tribes welfare schemes (Scholarships, SC/ST Sub-Plan)
Persons with Disabilities Act & Rights-based schemes (Deendayal Disabled Rehabilitation Scheme)
Senior citizen welfare: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS)
Measures for backward classes & OBCs (Scholarships, skill training)

name: Chapter 6: Poverty Alleviation & Employment Programs
topics: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) & JAM trinity in welfare delivery

name: Chapter 7: Urban & Rural Development Initiatives
topics: AMRUT & Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation
Community development programs & local governance linkages

name: Chapter 8: Environment & Social Sector Linkage
topics: Clean energy initiatives: Solar, Biogas, EV policy
Climate adaptation projects in vulnerable communities

name: Chapter 9: Evaluation & Challenges
topics: Monitoring & evaluation frameworks (NITI Aayog, CAG reports)
Gender & regional disparities in scheme benefits

name: Chapter 10: UPSC-Oriented Practice
topics: Prelims MCQs (schemes, objectives, ministries, launch years)
Mains GS-II & GS-III Questions (effectiveness, governance challenges, social sector reforms)
Essay Topics (Inclusive development, Social justice & governance, Health & education reforms)
Case Studies for Ethics (implementation challenges, citizen-centric delivery, corruption issues)

name: Chapter 1: Indian Polity & Governance
topics: Constitution of India: Features, Preamble, Parts, Schedules
Judiciary: Supreme Court, High Courts, Tribunals

name: Chapter 2: History of India
topics: Ancient India: Indus Valley, Vedic Period, Mauryas, Guptas
Medieval India: Delhi Sultanate, Mughals, Regional Kingdoms
Modern India: British Raj, Revolt of 1857, Freedom Struggle, Leaders
Indian National Movement: Congress, Gandhi Era, Independence

name: Chapter 3: Indian & World Geography
topics: Physical Geography: Mountains, Rivers, Oceans, Deserts, Plateaus
Important World Geography: Continents, Rivers, Deserts, Mountains

name: Chapter 4: Economy & Development
topics: Economic concepts: GDP, Inflation, Fiscal deficit, Monetary policy
Indian Economy: Sectors, Agriculture, Industry, Services
Economic Planning: Five-Year Plans, NITI Aayog

name: Chapter 6: Environment & Ecology
topics: Conservation programs: National Parks, Ramsar Sites
Climate Change, Global Warming & Treaties (Paris Agreement, Kyoto Protocol)

name: Chapter 7: Art, Culture & Heritage
topics: UNESCO World Heritage Sites in India & Globally

name: Chapter 8: International Organizations & Agreements
topics: UN, IMF, World Bank, WTO, WHO
Regional organizations: ASEAN, SAARC, EU, BRICS

name: Chapter 9: Awards & Recognitions
topics: Nobel, Bharat Ratna, Padma Awards, Olympic & Sports Awards

name: Chapter 11: UPSC-Oriented Practice
topics: Mains enrichment (examples, historical context, thematic links)
Quick Revision Notes & Tables for last-minute prep

name: Chapter 1: Introduction to Sustainable Development
topics: Importance in contemporary governance and policy-making

name: Chapter 3: Global Frameworks & Initiatives
topics: Paris Agreement, Kyoto Protocol, COP meetings
Global climate change initiatives & international cooperation

name: Chapter 4: National Policies & Strategies
topics: National Action Plan on Climate Change (NAPCC) & missions
Sustainable Agriculture Policies & Water Management initiatives
Renewable Energy policies & initiatives (Solar, Wind, Hydro, Green Hydrogen)

name: Chapter 5: Economic Dimensions of Sustainable Development
topics: Resource efficiency, sustainable urbanization, and transport

name: Chapter 6: Social Dimensions of Sustainable Development
topics: Education, health, gender equality, and social inclusion
Rural development & participatory governance (Panchayati Raj linkages)

name: Chapter 8: Technology & Innovation for Sustainability
topics: Role of science & technology in renewable energy

name: Chapter 9: Challenges in Sustainable Development
topics: Conflicts between economic growth & environmental protection

name: Chapter 10: Case Studies & Best Practices
topics: Success stories: Kerala’s literacy & health, Gujarat’s renewable energy, Ladakh’s water conservation
Global examples: Sweden’s circular economy, Costa Rica’s forest restoration

name: Chapter 11: UPSC-Oriented Practice
topics: Prelims MCQs (SDGs, NAPCC missions, global agreements)
Mains GS-III Questions (sustainable development strategies, policy evaluation, climate change mitigation)
Essay Topics (“Sustainable Development in India”, “Balancing Growth & Environment”, “Climate Change and Policy Response”)
Case Studies for Ethics (environmental justice, inclusive growth dilemmas)

name: Chapter 1: Introduction to the Constitution
topics: Historical Background (Regulating Act, Charter Acts, Government of India Acts, Indian Independence Act 1947)
Constituent Assembly & Drafting Committee (role of B.R. Ambedkar, Nehru, etc.)

name: Chapter 2: Features of the Indian Constitution
topics: Salient Features (length, federal structure, parliamentary system, secularism, etc.)
Sources of the Constitution (borrowed features from other countries)
Union vs. Federal vs. Unitary Characteristics

name: Chapter 3: Fundamental Rights & Duties
topics: Fundamental Rights (Articles 12–35) – scope, restrictions, important cases
Right to Equality, Freedom, Constitutional Remedies, etc.
Directive Principles of State Policy (Articles 36–51) – Gandhian, Socialist, Liberal

name: Chapter 4: Union & State Government
topics: President, Vice President, Prime Minister, Council of Ministers
Parliament (Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha, Powers & Functions)
Governor, Chief Minister & State Council of Ministers

name: Chapter 5: Judiciary in India
topics: Supreme Court – composition, powers, judicial review, judicial activism

name: Chapter 6: Federalism in India
topics: Inter-State Relations (River disputes, Zonal Councils, Inter-State Council)
Special Provisions for certain States (J&K, North-East, etc.)

name: Chapter 9: Amendments & Emergency Provisions
topics: Doctrine of Basic Structure (Kesavananda Bharati Case)

name: Chapter 10: Local Governance
topics: Role of PRIs in democracy & development

name: Chapter 11: Current Affairs & Constitution
topics: Key Supreme Court Judgments (Right to Privacy, Triple Talaq, Article 370, etc.)
Contemporary Issues: Uniform Civil Code, Electoral Reforms, Free Speech vs. Hate Speech

name: Chapter 12: Practice Section
topics: UPSC Prelims PYQs (Article-based, tricky factual ones)
Mock Tests + Answer Writing Practice (case-based, judgment-based)
